website_summaries.verdict: A quality wood filler that has earned the trust of builders and DIYers for good reason – it's easy to use and get results you'll love.
pros: A water-based formula that doesn't contain harmful ingredients, making it safe for the environment
Very easy to work with and sand
easy to clean up once project is complete
cons: Some stains may not work well with it
Colors can be challenging to match to wood

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: I have limited experience with wood filler, but this is way better than other stuff I’ve tried. The consistency is kind of like cake frosting: thick but light. Dries fast and easy to sand. If you’re trying to fill large holes or build up missing chunks of wood, be sure to apply in thin layers, letting it dry in between applications. If you slather it on too thick, it will never dry right.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product.
customer_reviews.text: This product is very effective. It works great. I had rotten plywood on my bay window. I cleaned up area from old plywood and covered it with this filler. It solidifies in about 1/2 hour and I mean it is solid! I painted over the whole are and one cannot tell the difference between the wood and filler just by looks. I only used a quarter of the cup. Be careful to read the instructions. I wore gloves to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Love Famowood
customer_reviews.text: A friend that works with wood recommended this to me. Goes on like spackle and sands like spackle but doesn't shrink and works like wood filler. Dries fast so keep lid on except when getting some out. Make sure lid is on firmly when finished. Filled screw holes on kitchen cabinets when converting 1970's exposed hinges with concealed hinges. Filled holes great, and after painting cannot see where they were.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is the best wood filler I have tried to date
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is the best wood filler I have tried to date. It has a great consistency and sands easily. It's very easy to feather out repairs. I have not tried staining it to know how it takes stain, but it takes paint just like the wood I'm repairing. It's nice that you can easily reconstitute it with a tiny bit of water and dried out bits return to a workable state after mixing with the good putty and letting sit over night. My only complaint would be that a square container like the elmer's products would be nicer since putty knifes are flat, not curved.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: This famowood Latex based wood filler is excellent. I used to use Famowood's solvent counterpart for ...
customer_reviews.text: This famowood Latex based wood filler is excellent. I used to use Famowood's solvent counterpart for many years but found it dried out too quickly. This filler is easier to sand, and doesn't stink like solvents. It says it is only for water based stains but it works fine with oil based stains that I use (professional/high quality pigmented stains). It will dry out if you don't press the lid very hard when closing the container so keep that in mind. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Best stainable wood filler on the market
customer_reviews.text: I bought several wood fillers and tested them all on a board. This one, by far, was the winner. Easy to use, clean up, sand, paint and/or stain. It performs perfectly and absolutely killed it against the other commonly used products. Put down the Elmer's, minwax, Bondo, dap, etc and just use this. This will still not be utterly invisible when staining, but it came the closest. I recommend cleaning up the edges where fill isn't needed with a wet cloth for the best result and cleaner sanding.
customer_reviews.author: Iliketurtles

customer_reviews.title: Cracks quickly
customer_reviews.text: The wood filler cracked with 2 days. It didn't matter if it was a 1/32 or 1/4 inch wide area being filled. This stuff cracked in every area that was filled.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Supplee

customer_reviews.title: I am conpletely satisfied; great product.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to sand also, and is very effective. Last year I ordered a small container and was very pleased with using it to repair dry rot wood trim and no later problems arose. Knowing this, I ordered a larger size and will continue it's use for more and larger repair jobs. Sheerness, not applicable as only needed painting as a finish. I plan on continued use until the product is altered to a lesser product which sometimes happens with the manufacturers or if distributors let the product get old. What I received was absulutely fresh. Thanks to all who have contributed to the process, up thru to delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Reason

customer_reviews.title: Great grain filler.  Easy to work with, affordable and fast delivery.
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to full in an open grain wood box. Well mixed, easily spread, clean up with water. Short drying time. Sanded easily with 400 grit paper. The only issue is getting the kid off. There's no easy way to do it. Used a rubber mallet to seal it back up. Should keep for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Spikulinium

customer_reviews.title: What is the point if I can't open the jar? Or reseal it
customer_reviews.text: The product itself may be good. Try opening the lid. I had to use tools to get it done and damaged the lid/jar enough that there is no way to seal it back. I used 0.1% of the product and I know I have to throw away the rest. What a waste. Do not buy unless you have a large project where you can use it all immediately. In my case, I need most of it but I only work weekends and I am pretty sure it won't last. It spreads easy enough. Longevity, I don't know.
customer_reviews.author: Haneef93Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Heaven-sent!
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews before I bought and a few carpenters recommended this! I have tried the minwax, elmer’s and they all cracked! This product is heaven scent and the smell isn’t as bad or as unpleasant!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy K.

customer_reviews.title: Not stainable, false claim by manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: The filler looked OK, and sanded OK, but did not accept stain. My application was pine stair treads, rough & cracked. We used the product, sanded it smooth, but after applying the dark early american stain, the patches remained blond; the surrounding pine stained as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: Great for filling large areas
customer_reviews.text: I read several reviews on wood fillers for large spots and this really did come through! I found an antique French door that someone was throwing out but it had large gouges missing from it bc of dog scratches. I sanded it all down to smooth it, but I had a 18”x3”x.5” gouge that needed to be filled— this did the trick! Only giving 4 stars as the first layer I applied really didn’t want to stick to the door and it was a pain to apply. Adhered much better the second and final time. Sanded very nicely!
customer_reviews.author: BK From BK

customer_reviews.title: Good product overall
customer_reviews.text: It does shrink, but very minimally so. Just apply a tiny bit extra and sand off the rest when it dries. It is easy to work with using a putty knife. Increasing the thickness applied to more than a few millimeters will increase your dry time substantially longer than the label indicates. Anything over a half a centimeter in thickness took overnight to dry. It is very easy to sand and it stains very well.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Dave

customer_reviews.title: Dried up, crumbly and difficult to work with
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I got a bad can of this stuff because I followed the reviews of others when I purchased. It was shrunken in the jar, pretty dry, crumbly, and does not spread well at all. It sanded off ok, but shrunk so much (was just filling a tiny crack between 2 boards), that i had to reapply and Resand. Pretty disappointed for the price. The stuff at the hardware store is much easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Renee A.

customer_reviews.title: Best Filler on the Market
customer_reviews.text: The best wood filler I have used. Went on easily and gave me enough time to do a good job filling the damaged wood before drying. Left it for 1 hour before sanding down. Paint went on super smooth over the top and you’d never know there was any damage to the wood in the first place. I’ve tried so many other products before this one and now this is my go to.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Not working very well for me.
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok. fairly easy to spread and dries pretty quickly. But as it dried it began to crack and every layer I put on the crack to cover it cracks as well. Probably going to have to scrape it up and start over kinda sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Just Alfie

customer_reviews.title: you have to froce to open it
customer_reviews.text: I think the bigger problem when using this product, it is how to open. I end up using the flat screwdriver to open. A bit expensive, but I use to repair my burn floor. If you dong take a close look, just look the same.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: You cannot stain over it to match existing stain.
customer_reviews.text: It says you are able to use a stain on the wood filler, yes, but it does not match the surrounding wood. So, what good is it if you are not able to use it, stain it, and it stands out like a neon light. Good product to use to fill a hole, crack, etc in wood, but don't use it if you want to match stained wood. I think if you were painting wood, it should match up. I personally do not see any advantages with this product than 90% of the other wood fillers out there. However, the description and rating make it sound like it will solve every problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product.. Color lighter than expected
customer_reviews.text: The product is good. But the color of the one I ordered was almost white after curing. I have yellow knot pine floors. I need to order a darker shade. Need a more golden shade.
customer_reviews.author: WSD2

customer_reviews.title: Best wood filler on the market
customer_reviews.text: This is THE absolute BEST wood filler! I’ve tried so many other products by other brands (Minwax, Elmer’s, DAP) and not one of them comes anywhere close to this one. The other brands claim to be stainable but they really aren’t! this product doesn’t crack or shrink and dries in minutes! Once you have used this product, you won’t use anything else ever again!
customer_reviews.author: Elsa

customer_reviews.title: Wood Filler
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to hide the grain in my oak kitchen cabinets. This was not what I expected. I You Tubed this product and they had good things to say. It is very messy as it produces a lot of dust. I ended up leaving the cabinets as is and the grain does not bother me at all. My self leveling paint was able to hide some of the grain.
customer_reviews.author: L. Zen

customer_reviews.title: The best for sure
customer_reviews.text: Work quickly, but this is the best wood filler I've used. Filled deep grooves in an old desk top for a smooth finish before painting. No hint of it not being a part of the original pieces of furniture once painted. Hook your shopvac up to your sander of you're doing this indoors!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and easy to work with.
customer_reviews.text: Famowood is fantastic! It was recommended on a Pinterest post. We are refacing the kitchen cabinets and using it for dings and filling holes. It has a smooth consistency and sands well. I do recommend that you take out a small portion at a time and seal the container tightly EVERY TIME.
customer_reviews.author: R. Grow

customer_reviews.title: excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: this product is easy to use and the color matched almost identically and applying it was easy peasy and the outcome was exactly what i wanted. plan on buying this again and would highly recommend this if you have small or large wood imperfections that need patching up. dries fast and can be sanded and stained!! great buy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: ZenSiafu

customer_reviews.title: Worked great. Did not shrink as most do.
customer_reviews.text: Did a great job for me on filling a pretty large hole. First filler I've used that really didn't shrink. Sands down nicely. It's painted so don't know how it would match stain. In my experience, none do that well.
customer_reviews.author: R. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Easiest solution for filling small nail heads or large holes that have rotted away.
customer_reviews.text: This famowood is Ideal for filling even large holes in wood; just put a small amount at a time until it is filled or it will leave crackes in the surface; easy cleanup and easy to sand after it has hardened.
customer_reviews.author: Boy Roy

customer_reviews.title: Lid is incredibly hard to open
customer_reviews.text: If I had known how hard it would be to open the container I never would have gone with this product. I can't review how the product actually works, because I can't even get the lid off.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley P

customer_reviews.title: This is top shelf!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a couple of different products to smooth out the rough open grain of old wood. This is by far the best that I have found. Easy to spread. It goes on smooth and thin. It sticks very well. It sands nicely due to the very fine aggregate that they use. It is also very durable! OMG throw out every thing else and use this product!
customer_reviews.author: D Dubb

customer_reviews.title: Overall Good Product
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended by none other than Bob Villa so I believed it would be of high quality. It worked well. The main complaint I have is that the filler seemed to settle more than I expected so there ended up being a divot in the deck that I was working on. Overall good product.
customer_reviews.author: Neal M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This wood filler works great. Used to repair damaged roof fascia and fence. Easy to apply ( I used a butter knife), dries very fast and is very solid. Sanded and painted after filler dried. Looks perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Armijo

customer_reviews.title: I'm a fan
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. Easy to spread/apply. Durable finish. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Pibb

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t buy again
customer_reviews.text: Application was easy however after 3days of baking in the sun rain washed the majority of product away.
customer_reviews.author: Verified purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Terrific product.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great and very easy to work with. I repaired very old abused stairs using this. Sanded very easily by hand and painted over the dried filler with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Larissa Harwick

customer_reviews.title: Easy for amateurs to use.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. Easy to apply and easy to sand down to level before painting. It would not be great for holding in a screw, but then, it is not made for that.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy A

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice
customer_reviews.text: I use this to fill small gaps and screw holes in furniture that I build. Works well, sands easily, holds up well. When stained, the filler appears darker/lighter than the surrounding wood but I guess that's to be expected. It's still my first choice for wood filler.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Weiner

customer_reviews.title: Not my fav
customer_reviews.text: This product was a bit of disappointment considering the cost. It was easy to apply and once it was dry it was easy to sand. After drying it does seem solid, but it cracks. And I think I could have gotten the same results from a product that was one third the cost of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki B.

customer_reviews.title: Drys quick and hard, easy to paint
customer_reviews.text: I had a bunch of paint bubbles. I used this to even out the paint bubble and painted over it. It worked great. It drys nice and hard within about 30 minutes. I will be buying more when this tub runs out
customer_reviews.author: mkgriesinger

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for wood
customer_reviews.text: First time using. Impressed at adhesion and sanding. Will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Terry L. Purdin

customer_reviews.title: Cannot get lid off
customer_reviews.text: It took two of us and a screw driver to get the lid of and it was so mangled it was unusable. The puddy itself is fine but its useless now since there isn't a lid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Applies easily, but doesn't take stain well
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, but it will take several, detailed attempts at staining before getting the colors close.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Works well...
customer_reviews.text: but I like powdered stuff better because you can make it the consistency that works for you
customer_reviews.author: StLBill

customer_reviews.title: I found it didn’t take stain well at all.
customer_reviews.text: As the subject line reads, it didn’t take stain well at all, leaving a very conspicuous patch in a wood project. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: PB_Blimp

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Used on an old wooden gate that was starting to fall apart. Handle Screws were coming out but after applying Wood Filler screws held firmly. Applied easily to wood and easy to sand.
customer_reviews.author: Layniez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, Easy to sand and it dries pretty quickly!
customer_reviews.text: I only buy this for my furniture making! Easy to use, easy to sand and it dries pretty quickly. I do wish the lid was made better; The lid pops off easily. I recommend this wood filler. You get a whole lot of good putty for the price! ;)
customer_reviews.author: G.B.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: A little lighter than the plywood I applied it to, like a peach vs standard plywood, but did the job and has held up so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jake K.

customer_reviews.title: best water based wood filler ever.
customer_reviews.text: This filler can be thinned with water. The package can be resealed tightly, preventing hardening of the filler. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Rothenhoefer

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wood filler after reading that this is a product Norm Abram (master carpenter from This Old House and The New Yankee Workshop) uses. I was not let down. This filler is easy to work with, dries fast, sands down nicely, and accepts paint without bleeding through. I will definitely continue to use this product for future projects.
customer_reviews.author: J Sutton

customer_reviews.title: The best stuff
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect wood filler. It really holds stain and matches the wood the best after staining.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It took a little to work it into some of the cracks in the wood but otherwise seems to be holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Capistrant

customer_reviews.title: Better than what you'd find at a big box store
customer_reviews.text: I really liked working with this product. Much better than what I've found locally. Not sure why I can't find it at the big named store. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Gobi55

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I redo old furniture a lot & this is great for just that purpose. Its easy to use, dries quick & stays put.
customer_reviews.author: PME

customer_reviews.title: I finally found my favorite wood filler.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried at least 10 different brands and types of wood fillers. This is the best, hands down. Spreads easily. Doesn’t dry out while using. No smell. It is smooth, not like those with the little wood pieces in them.
customer_reviews.author: samsmom

customer_reviews.title: Did not take stain
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly hard when dried and easy to use/spread. However it did not take the stain color after it was dry. In the future I will try mixing a little stain in the product before applying. Otherwise a terrific product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive for amount you get
customer_reviews.text: Seems good but I think is very expensive for amount
customer_reviews.author: FlagstaffGuy

customer_reviews.title: Work perfect
customer_reviews.text: Worked as it said it would. Dries a lighter color
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Different from the others
customer_reviews.text: This is our favorite wood filler we have ever used. Easy to sand
customer_reviews.author: C W

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT FILLER
customer_reviews.text: Spreads easily, adheres to wood and Epoxy, sands easily, strong when cured.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect... it is already mixed.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is so easy to work with. It does take a long time to dry though if your hold is too deep. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Yolie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very moist filler, very easy to use and spread. Don't shrink
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: This is filler it does not add strength nor is it a bondo product
customer_reviews.text: This pruduct is like drywall pazte for wood.. dries chalky and brittle. Not good if wood needs strengt
customer_reviews.author: Frank Richter

customer_reviews.title: Good wood repair stuff
customer_reviews.text: I used it when I installed crown moulding. Excellent for touch-up
customer_reviews.author: Jack Baker

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: This is the best wood filler made in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri B. Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Accepts minwax stains
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and took two different Minwax stains that I have used very well. Dries quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Watson

customer_reviews.title: Baby small
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used I yet but ordered it thinking it's a normal bucket of it it isn't it's like a baby size should of read it better ig
customer_reviews.author: richard

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy clean up!
customer_reviews.text: This product is so easy to use and it does what suppose too.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Best filler I’ve ever used and the only one I’ll purchase going forward
customer_reviews.author: "stewie40"

customer_reviews.title: A must for every wood lover
customer_reviews.text: Great product and spreads on easy and levels out smooth. Dries pretty fast too! A must for word working projects!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Butler

customer_reviews.title: Found it cleaned up nice with a towel on areas I didn't want it
customer_reviews.text: Found it cleaned up nice with a towel on areas I didn't want it. Has not taken to staining very easily. Compared to other similar products, this item may be a bit over priced.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: It's a good wood filler and comes in various wood colors.
customer_reviews.text: I liked how it filled in the crevices and holes in the wood. Also, the short time it took to dry. It was easy to sand flat and clean up. I only wished it came in larger containers since I have a 20ft x 16ft deck.
customer_reviews.author: John Dioszeghy

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: This product is loved by my entire family. I have to keep my eye on this during projects
customer_reviews.author: Susan Browning

customer_reviews.title: False statement, "Takes stains". NO it doesn't.
customer_reviews.text: "Takes stains and ...". No it doesn't. It stays about the same color after staining. I am going to keep looking better filler.
customer_reviews.author: Onsenboy

customer_reviews.title: Good and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but it is the best wood filler I've ever used (by a long shot). Sands easily!
customer_reviews.author: skyshot

customer_reviews.title: no woodiness
customer_reviews.text: "wood" filler very misleading. has no woodiness at all. nice paste...that's it. will not purchase or recommend! Thank you for asking.
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: Strong, east to use & sand.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use filler. Dries pretty quickly. Shrinkage is minimal. Strong but easy to sand.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for outside wood staircase!
customer_reviews.text: Works as reviewed..my outside stairs take a beating in direct sunlight. Prouduct was easy to spread and sand. Painted the next day looks like new!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the best wood fill
customer_reviews.text: Was exactly what I wanted. Worked perfectly filling holes that woodpeckers had drilled in my deck.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: fulfilling filler
customer_reviews.text: High-quality filler. Very little shrinkage, good adhesion, relatively fast drying (relative to ambient temperature and humidity) and very smooth texture.
customer_reviews.author: Constant Builder

customer_reviews.title: Effortless to sand and mold
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to rebuilt an old door with dings in the frame work and molding. This product is extremely versatile to mold and sand.
customer_reviews.author: Thure Wester

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the natural. Dries very nicely. Thin coats dry the best.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t stain the same as the wood.
customer_reviews.text: The product didn’t accept the stain the same way as the wood.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Costa

customer_reviews.title: It is a great product. I have used it to repair some ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a great product. I have used it to repair some weathered windows wood - once the product dries, it can be sanded and painted back like new.
customer_reviews.author: Khursheed Anwar

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: works great! I didn't stain anything just used a sealer over it so I can not judge on the aspect. Ordered 2 of these for my counter top I made out of 2x4s. Will use this product again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Best wood filler I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: Best wood filler I've ever used- it puts all the big box hardware store fillers to shame. It's smooth enough to dilute with water and use as pore filler. As a paste (when first opened) it will fill deep gashes, but may require a few passes. Plus, it bonds so tight it's hard to scrape off your finger nails. I've had it get wet before being sanded and it stayed in place. It takes stain well. My only word of warning is that it stings a bit if it gets in any little scratches in your skin.
customer_reviews.author: Lyssa

customer_reviews.title: Works well and no smell
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff. Works well and no smell and soap and water clean-up.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Raine

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff but poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: I thought this worked great but the only reason I am giving it 4 stars is because you need an army of flat-head screwdrivers to get the lid off, at least that was my experience. It was impressively tough. It was a flimsy lid which you think would make it easy, but it actually makes it harder. I used this to fill nail holes in baseboard. I used a small putty knife to scrape the holes smooth and I did not even have to sand the wood filler afterward. I also used it in other areas that required sanding thereafter, and this stuff sands very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: casopolis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very smooth and easy to work with. I'd get it again.
customer_reviews.author: Ekavihari

customer_reviews.title: goes on easy, dries quickly
customer_reviews.text: Color matches, goes on easy, dries quickly, and sands smooth. My #1 wood filler ....
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Looks like cement
customer_reviews.text: Looks like crap, it's too grainy and doesn't take stain well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Moriarty

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff but when sanding it says you can get cancer from breathing the dust...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good filler
customer_reviews.text: I really like this putty. It is easy to work with and the excess sands right off.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brett Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Place small sheet of plastic over the container, then put the top on over the plastic. Won't dry out
customer_reviews.text: Love this wood filler. I use it all the time. I do restoration work on antiques and build reproduction fine furniture. To extend the life many people suggest storing it upside down... I've found that to be helpful. But if you cover the container with a small sheet of plastic then put the top on the plastic will make it air tight, or at least damned close. Mine doesn't dry out when I use the plastic under the lid.
customer_reviews.author: Deliverance

customer_reviews.title: not really stainable
customer_reviews.text: If you are using this product to fill holes in blonde woods such as pine, fur, or maple, it's great. The holes disappear. But it does not stain like the surrounding wood. I haven't found any wood filler that does. So if you are filling holes in blonde woods, fine. If you want to fill holes in blonde wood and then stain it walnut, forget it. But that's no different than the other 10 fillers I have tried. It's a good product; just realize its limitations.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Does not dry
customer_reviews.text: I filled a half-inch knot, but it was still wet to the touch 24 hours later. I removed the original paste, which was still wet, and tried applying it in a much smaller layer, say 1/8". I even had a fan blow air on it. The room temperature was around 55 degrees (this was in a garage). But an hour later, it was still moist to the touch and got onto my finger when I touched it. I gave up, removed it all with a paper towel (it was still wet enough to wipe off with a paper towel), and I used J-B Weld KwikWood epoxy instead. I would not recommend this product. Even Elmer's is better.
customer_reviews.author: lk

customer_reviews.title: Won’t accept stain - bummer
customer_reviews.text: I was led to believe that this filler accepted stain wonderfully - not! I used the filler on a door, let it dry, sanded it and then applied the stain. Now I have white blotches anywhere I applied the filler. A week later it still won’t stain. Now what do I do?
customer_reviews.author: J. Denton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply
customer_reviews.text: I've used a few wood fillers in the past. Often times they don't want to grab especially on large gaps. This one gets top marks for adhesion. Super easy to use. I restored this wood patio table that had loads of cracks and gaps. Due to the amount of filler needed, about half the container, I will probably just paint it instead of staining. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Stylianou

customer_reviews.title: works well.
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my brothers deck. I was helping him paint it. Some of the boards needed wood puddy. This didn't dry as quick as it said, and it did crack and shrink a bit. I just added a little more the next day. I did let it dry 24 hours before painting. All and all, I liked it though. It was very hot and humid the days I used it, and it was outside, so that my have affected the way it dried.
customer_reviews.author: Sheree MS

customer_reviews.title: This Product Is Worthless.
customer_reviews.text: Used this on new wood posts and flooring we put on front porch. We applied it 'by the book.' As soon as we sanded it, it totally disintegrated. Had to redo the entire porch with a different product. We have no idea why on earth this product was rated #1 by several woodworking sites. It is worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Peach

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done
customer_reviews.text: I had a rotten bottom door that I needed to fix. It required a little deep plastering with this product and had to wait overnight (16hrs) vs the 30 minutes recommendation from the manufacturer. Initial application showed a crack after hardening but I reapplied more into the cracks and that fixed the crack issue. I painted over it and about a month later it looks good. If this does not hold or I start seeing cracks I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: callmeish

customer_reviews.title: Great when fully sealed from water
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to mix, easy to work with, dries solid. But it’s good to keep in mind that it’s not waterproof, and in fact it soaks up water a little bit. So if you’re going to use it on a piece of wood that will get wet, make sure the putty dries fully before painting it, and make sure the wood (and the putty) is primed and painted on all sides.
customer_reviews.author: Lilheart17

product_meta.title: FamoWood 40022126 Latex Wood Filler - Pint, Natural
product_meta.description: FAMOWOOD Water-Based Wood Filler - Environmentally safe and sound Famowood offers a water-based wood filler which meets the growing demands for a product that has little or no impact on the environment, yet maintains the qualities of our time tested solvent based products. Can be stained, sawed, drilled, sanded, planed, painted, and nailed like real wood. Fills holes and cracks quickly, dries in 15 minutes with no noticeable shrinkage, cracking, or crumbling. Indoor or outdoor use. Nontoxic with no solvent fumes. Soap and water clean up. - Color: Natural, Size: 24 Oz., Pkg Qty: 1, Package Type: Can WARNING: This product can expose you to chemicals including wood dust particles and respirable crystalline silica which are known to the State of California to cause cancer. For more information go to www.p65warnings.ca.gov. -
feature_bullets: Won't crack or shrink, solvent free – low odor and easy water cleanup
Can be sanded, drilled or planed
Solvent free, professional quality wood filler
Takes stains and paints like real wood
Dries in 15 minutes with no signs of shrinkage, cracking or crumbling
